It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves that are adapted to arid conditions. The plant produces delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Acronia alvaroi thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich environments.
